message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with coding theory and specifically with the construction of Minimum Storage Regenerating (MSR) codes, which are used for efficient data storage and retrieval. This falls under the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DS) categories. The paper also involves the study of the sub-packetization of codes, which is related to the complexity of the encoding and decoding algorithms, and can be classified under the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) and Signal Processing (cs.SI) categories. Finally, the paper deals with the optimization of repair bandwidth, which is related to network communication and can be classified under the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) category.
